isis.stitle: 530 and DT-466/408 Diesel Engine Diagnostics (1993) - EGED-115 DIAGNOSTIC ANALYSIS GUIDE FOR THE INTERNATIONAL(r) 530 and DT-408/466 DIESEL ENGINES WITH ROBERT BOSCH "P" INJECTION PUMP [FRONT SIDE] - INJECTION PUMP STATIC TIMING (ENGINE STOPPED) - (Static) Timing Check

step1.para: Remove injection pump gear drive access cover from front of engine and discard O' ring.

warning.para: Shut-off must be in the no-fuel position before proceeding.

step1.para: Rotate the engine in the normal operating direction until the #1 piston is on the compression stroke and the mark on the damper pulley is aligned with the correct timing mark on the timing indicator for the particular engine application. (See Performance Data Guidlines this section)

note.para: The kidney shaped hole in the injection pump drive gear should be approximately at the 11:00 o'clock position when the #1 piston is on the compression stroke. Refer to Figure 5.7.

step1.para: Thread plunger pin (ZTSE-4373) into timing hole. If plunger pin enters the timing hole, injection timing is ok. If plunger pin does not enter timing hole, remove the plunger pin tool from gear.

important.para: THE PLUNGER PIN TOOL MUST BE REMOVED TO AVOID DAMAGING THE TOOL.

step1.para: Loosen the four cap-screws which secure the gear to the injection pump. Rotate injection pump with socket wrench to align the small hole in the drive gear hub with the lock plate hole behind the pump drive hub. Torque the four capscrews which secure the gear to the injection pump using the correct torque specification. Re-thread the timing plunger pin tool into the timing hole. If plunger pin enters timing hole, injection pump timing is correctly set.
Re-install gear cover using a new O" ring seal.
Enter the observed pump to engine timing in the 1st check block of EGED-115 - *.
